trial_identification.studytitle: Perfusion index as a predictor for optimum positive end -expiratory pressure in Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome patients management
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Perfusion index as a predictor for optimum positive end-expiratory pressure(PEEP) in acute respiratory distress syndrome(ARDS) patients management

conditions.healthcondition: We will study the relation between perfusion index and optimum PEEP in Acute respiratory distress syndrome(ARDS) patients

interventions.interventions: We will titrate the PEEP level from baseline(5cm.H2O) by increments of 2cm.H2O for 30 minutes for each PEEP level till reaching the value of optimum PEEP that corresponds to best oxygenation(Pao2-sao2 and hypoxic index ) and correlates it with the perfusion index changes in ARDS patients.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Optimum PEEP in ARDS patients. tools used include hemodynamic parameters(MAP-C.V.P.) ,oxygenation parameters(Pao2-sao2-hypoxic index{pao2/fio2} )-static compliance- dead space to tidal volue ratio(Vd/Vt).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 6 hours after confirmation of ARDS diagnosis

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: ARDS patients due to pulmonary causes (eg severe pneumonia).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Extra pulmonary causes of ARDS, pneumothorax, coagulapathy CHF , cardiogenic pulmonary edema, hemodynamics instability.

trial_design.statisticalmethods: Data are presented as median , range values . paired T. test will be used. Sample size , according to the survey system software.we assumed confidence level of 95% at appropriate confidence interval to detect 15% difference in perfusion index ,the sample size of total 20 cases was calculated(www.surveysystem.com).
